thread.title: Manchester United set to earn millions if Michael Keane leaves Burnley at the end of the season
thread.title_full: Manchester United set to earn millions if Michael Keane leaves Burnley at the end of the season

author: Marc Isaacs
title: Manchester United set to earn millions if Michael Keane leaves Burnley at the end of the season
text:
Sport Manchester United set to earn millions if Michael Keane leaves Burnley at the end of the season Jose Mourinho could see his transfer budget increase considerably if Burnley decided to cash in on their star defender during the summer Share United will earn a cash windfall if Keane leaves Burnely (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United could be set for a cash windfall if Burnley sell influential defender Michael Keane at the end of the season. 
Jose Mourinho could have millions added into his transfer kitty if the 24-year-old defender leaves Turf Moore as United stand to make a big investment from any future transfer. 
Keane has been earning rave reviews for Burnley in the top flight and was rewarded when he made his senior debut for England against Germany on Wednesday night. Keane has been earning rave reviews for Burnley (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Michael Keane can return to Manchester United and become a huge star 
According to the Daily Mail, a clause was inserted into Keane’s contract when he was transferred from United to Burnley for £2.5million back in January 2015 and they can now receive up to 25 per cent from any future transfer. 
Keane looks certain to attract a number of big clubs wanting his signature with Liverpool, Everton, Manchester City and Chelsea believed to be among the teams following his progress. Keane made his England debut against Germany on Wednesday night (Photo: Getty) 
Burnley will be looking for at least £20million for their star defender who still has a year to run on his current deal and has turned down the chance to extend his stay at Turf Moor. 
United will be keeping a close eye on the situation and stand to earn a sizeable chunk from any big move Keane makes if he leaves during the summer. poll loading Will Liverpool sign Michael Keane? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
